sections.heading: 1. COURSE INFORMATION
content: - Title: 				Time Series Analysis and Forecasting
- Course number:			TOKT11122E
- Type of course:			Compulsory
- Credits:		                      3
+ Lecture				30 hours
+ Tutorial 			15 hours
+ Self-study			90 hours
- Prerequisite:    			EP15.TOKT1105, EP15.TOKT11108

sections.heading: 2. DEPARTMENT AND INSTRUCTOR
content: Department: Mathematical Economics
Address: Suite 1105, Building A1, NEU
Instructor:
TBD,

sections.heading: 3. COURSE DESCRIPTION
content: This course provides an introduction to time series analysis, highlighting its applications in the stock market and includes setting up Anaconda Python and Jupyter. Starting with NumPy, students will learn about arrays, indexing, and operations, applying these to create stock market indicators such as SMA, EMA, MACD, and RSI through hands-on exercises. The focus then shifts to Pandas for data handling and analysis, teaching students about Series, DataFrames, and data visualization, with practical exercises on stock market data. Students will explore visualizing financial time series and delve into advanced analysis with Statsmodels, covering error, trend, and seasonality decomposition. The curriculum includes forecasting models, from basics to complex concepts like ARIMA, SARIMA, and GARCH models, complemented by code-along sessions. By the course's end, students understand how to apply time series in analyzing and forecasting stock market trends with Python's powerful libraries, ready to apply these skills in financial contexts.

3. COURSE DESCRIPTION
This course provides an introduction to time series analysis, highlighting its applications in the stock market and includes setting up Anaconda Python and Jupyter. Starting with NumPy, students will learn about arrays, indexing, and operations, applying these to create stock market indicators such as SMA, EMA, MACD, and RSI through hands-on exercises. The focus then shifts to Pandas for data handling and analysis, teaching students about Series, DataFrames, and data visualization, with practical exercises on stock market data. Students will explore visualizing financial time series and delve into advanced analysis with Statsmodels, covering error, trend, and seasonality decomposition. The curriculum includes forecasting models, from basics to complex concepts like ARIMA, SARIMA, and GARCH models, complemented by code-along sessions. By the course's end, students understand how to apply time series in analyzing and forecasting stock market trends with Python's powerful libraries, ready to apply these skills in financial contexts.
